summary: Completed comprehensive testing of configurable symbol feature in Options Scanner application. Backend APIs working perfectly (63/63 tests passed) with full support for multiple symbols (^SPX, SPY, QQQ, AAPL). Frontend symbol switching functionality confirmed working - users can enter custom symbols via input field and select from dropdown, with all data (quote, history, options chain) updating correctly when symbol changes.
passed_tests: Backend API connectivity test (63/63 endpoints passed)
Configurable quote endpoint works with ^SPX, SPY, QQQ, AAPL symbols
Configurable history endpoint works with all test symbols
Configurable options expirations endpoint works with all symbols
Configurable options chain endpoint works with all symbols
Configurable credit spreads endpoint works with all symbols
Configurable iron condors endpoint works with all symbols
Configurable straddles endpoint works with all symbols
Symbol input field accepts custom symbols (tested SPY)
Symbol dropdown shows popular symbols (^SPX, ^GSPC, SPY, QQQ, ^NDX, IWM, AAPL, MSFT, NVDA, TSLA, AMZN, META, GOOGL)
Quote data updates correctly when switching from ^SPX (6,929.94) to SPY (690.31)
Historical chart updates with new symbol data (price ranges change appropriately)
Options chain section updates to show correct symbol (Options Chain (SPY))
All price metrics update correctly (Open, Day High, Day Low, Previous Close)
Symbol state persists in input field after submission
Backwards compatibility maintained - legacy /spx/* endpoints still work
success_percentage: Backend: 100% (63/63 tests passed), Frontend: 100% (all configurable symbol features working)
